intro: Idahoa, commonly known as the Idaho lily, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in mountainous regions. Idahoa has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces tall, upright stems. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
